column5: I took a break from targeting steelhead and just focused on the suckers.  Suckers need love too.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zv_JRSx4ltQ  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eZ4eqyoOOYk
Those are whistlemouth trout.  The Don sure looks good..back in my day there it was a brown thick mess..how far up are you

^^^ I wish I knew a place where I can use these suckers for channel cats in the city.  Those are whistlemouth trout.  The Don sure looks good..back in my day there it was a brown thick mess..how far up are you  I'm actually close to the lower Don.  I've heard stories how the don was such a mess back in the days.  People would just dump anything in that river from motorcycles to unwanted vehicles.

^^^ I wish I knew a place where I can use these suckers for channel cats in the city.   I'm actually close to the lower Don.  I've heard stories how the don was such a mess back in the days.  People would just dump anything in that river from motorcycles to unwanted vehicles.  Back in the day, they searched the Don for Jimmy Hoffa, but then realized that he hadn't cleared the Canadian Customs at Windsor and went back to searching in Michigan
Weird. Always thought nothing could live and swim in the Don
^^^ Lots swimming and plenty to catch.  More suckers...  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eZ4eqyoOOYk
Gotta do this some day. Looks like a blast!
chinooks and steelhead make their way up there.  not in any great numbers but they do come up.   my friend sent me a pic of a bunch of black chinneys back in september.
"Suckahs"  I watched the first one. You got the know PUMP.
